data.name: MENU_RANDOMIZER_TOP
data.comment: Label of the randomizer option on the title (top) menu.

data.name: MENU_RANDOMIZER_TITLE
data.comment: Title of the Randomizer window when opened.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_MENU_SEEDING
data.comment: Label of the seeding menu option, used to control how things randomize.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_MENU_CACHING
data.comment: Label of the caching menu option, used to control randomizer optimization.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_MENU_POKEMON
data.comment: Label of the Pokemon menu option, containing stat, ability, and evolution randomization.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_MENU_ITEMS
data.comment: Label of the Items menu option, containing item stat and appearance randomization.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_MENU_MOVES
data.comment: Label of the Moves menu options, controlling Power, AoE, and typing.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_MENU_DUNGEONS
data.comment: Label of the Dungeons menu option, controlling dungeon appearance and traits.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_MENU_NAMING
data.comment: Label of the Naming menu option, controlling dungeon, item, and Pokemon names.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_MENU_STATUSES
data.comment: Label of the Status Effects menu option.

data.name: RANDOMIZER_CLEAR_FILES
data.value: This will clear every modified file from the randomizer, returning everything to normal.[br]Your current save will likely not play correctly after this.[pause=0] Continue?
data.comment: Label of the Status Effects menu option.

data.name: PMDOR_CHANGELOG_2025-03-07
data.value:
* Project started, here be dragons! * Additionally started mentoolkit to handle UI creation and controls.
Currently no functionality besides the Top Menu option, but here's hoping!

data.name: PMDOR_CHANGELOG_2025-03-08
data.value:
+ Changelog menu added
+ Plausibility confirmations have been performed. Tests have gone as follows: * Pokemon info can be changed. * Type 1 & Type 2 * Learnsets * Base Stats * Intrinsics? * Move info can be changed. * Type & Category * Base Power & Accuracy * Hitboxes / AoE * Status effects can be changed. * Item info can be changed. * Names * Icons & Sprites * Price & Max Stack * Dropability * Entire use events [color=#ffaa00]* Dungeon changes might work. Unsure of data locations or publicity.

data.name: PMDOR_CHANGELOG_2025-03-09
data.value:
This is infinitely more obtuse than expected thanks to the unreasonable action of trying to safe memory. How dare they?!
On the bright side, I probably don't need cachers anymore. I just need to make overrides now. The downside? Lots of file generation.
This info above is immediately outdated. Some things require caching, while others do not. This is also very useful.
Fully Cached: - Elements - GrowthData Not Fully Caches: - Monsters (reasonable) - Moves (reasonable) ... to be tested
+ CSHook.lua - CSHook.lua

Status Effects - [ ] Generate new effects - [ ] Perish Song duration - [ ] Poison damage Moves - [ ] Types & Category - [ ] Base Power & Accuracy - [ ] Hitboxes / Range Items - [ ] Icons & Sprites - [ ] Prices - [ ] Stack Size - [ ] Use Events Naming - [ ] Pokemon - [ ] Items - [ ] Moves - [ ] Dungeons Dungeons (unknown) - [ ] Tileset Shuffle - [ ] Generation type shuffle
